questions.correctAnswer: An international movement that redefined Western cultures' perspectives on themselves and their world
options: An artistic and philosophical movement primarily about love
An international movement that redefined Western cultures' perspectives on themselves and their world
A literary phenomenon predominantly found in countries speaking romance languages
A cultural shift originating from Germany and England
questions.question: What is Romanticism?

questions.correctAnswer: The first edition of Lyrical Ballads by Wordsworth and Coleridge
options: The first edition of Lyrical Ballads by Wordsworth and Coleridge
The composition of Hymns to the Night by Novalis
The death of Sir Walter Scott and Goethe
The invention of the printing press
questions.question: Which of the following events marks the beginning of the Romantic period?
Which of these countries was NOT a stronghold of the Romantic Movement?

questions.correctAnswer: Because it was the year of the first edition of Lyrical Ballads by Wordsworth and Coleridge and of the composition of Hymns to the Night by Novalis
options: Because it was the year when both Sir Walter Scott and Goethe died
Because it was the year of the first edition of Lyrical Ballads by Wordsworth and Coleridge and of the composition of Hymns to the Night by Novalis
Because it was the year that marked the end of Romanticism
Because it was the year of the invention of the printing press in Germany
questions.question: Why is it significant that the Romantic period began in 1798?
